snippet: Advocates say that New York’s former archbishop reopened wounds in a new interview in which he said that he never should have apologized for the church’s handling of the sexual-abuse crisis and that no abuse had occurred on his watch.

headline.main: Cardinal Egan Criticized for Retracting Apology on Sexual Abuse Crisis
headline.print_headline: Retired Cardinal Regrets ’02 Apology on Abuse Cases
